main_definition: To encircle, enclose or be adjacent to something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To surround with a line of people or things
meanings_and_examples.example: The crowd began to surround the stage as soon as the band appeared.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be located on all sides or in every direction by something
meanings_and_examples.example: The small town was nestled among lush green hills, surrounded by nature.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To encircle a location with barriers or boundaries
meanings_and_examples.example: Security guards surround the entrance of the building to prevent unauthorized access.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be involved in and affected by something as if it surrounded you
meanings_and_examples.example: The challenges he faced at work began to surround him, making it difficult to focus on anything else.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To form a circle or surrounding shape around an object or area
meanings_and_examples.example: She arranged the flowers in such a way that they formed a beautiful circular pattern when surrounded by leaves.
